text: Little men with little minds and little imaginations go through life in little ruts, smugly resisting all changes which would jar their little worlds.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Life was always a matter of waiting for the right moment to act.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day.
author: E. B. White

text: Never try to impress a woman, because if you do she'll expect you to keep up the standard for the rest of your life.
author: W. C. Fields

text: Life is tough, but it's tougher when you're stupid.
author: John Wayne

text: I do not regret one moment of my life.
author: Lillie Langtry

text: Every man is the architect of his own life. He builds it just the way he wants it. However, after he has built what he wants, he sometimes decides that he doesn't like what he has built and looks for someone or something to blame instead of changing himself.
author: Sydney Madwed

text: The most exhausting thing in life is being insincere.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

text: Life is hard it's harder if you're stupid.
author: John Wayne

text: What a wee little part of a person's life are his acts and his words! His real life is led in his head, and is known to none but himself.
author: Mark Twain

text: Life all comes down to a few moments. This is one of them.
author: Charlie Sheen

text: I really haven't had that exciting of a life. There are a lot of things I wish I would have done, instead of just sitting around and complaining about having a boring life. So I pretty much like to make it up. I'd rather tell a story about somebody else.
author: Kurt Cobain

text: In poverty and other misfortunes of life, true friends are a sure refuge. The young they keep out of mischief to the old they are a comfort and aid in their weakness, and those in the prime of life they incite to noble deeds.
author: Aristotle

text: I haven't understood a bar of music in my life, but I have felt it.
author: Igor Stravinsky

text: If you love life, don't waste time, for time is what life is made up of.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time, for that is the stuff life is made of.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The first thing which I can record concerning myself is, that I was born. These are wonderful words. This life, to which neither time nor eternity can bring diminution - this everlasting living soul, began. My mind loses itself in these depths.
author: Groucho Marx

text: Let us put our minds together and see what life we can make for our children.
author: Sitting Bull

text: Character develops itself in the stream of life.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Life is too short to worry about anything. You had better enjoy it because the next day promises nothing.
author: Eric Davis

text: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: A bachelor's life is a fine breakfast, a flat lunch, and a miserable dinner.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Literature adds to reality, it does not simply describe it. It enriches the necessary competencies that daily life requires and provides and in this respect, it irrigates the deserts that our lives have already become.
author: C. S. Lewis

text: I don't believe in an afterlife, so I don't have to spend my whole life fearing hell, or fearing heaven even more. For whatever the tortures of hell, I think the boredom of heaven would be even worse.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: You want to believe that there's one relationship in life that's beyond betrayal. A relationship that's beyond that kind of hurt. And there isn't.
author: Caleb Carr

text: A man who views the world the same at fifty as he did at twenty has wasted thirty years of his life.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The more sand has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

text: Life is half spent before we know what it is.
author: George Herbert

text: I'm so glad I never feel important, it does complicate life!
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: My life is my message.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The only way to enjoy anything in this life is to earn it first.
author: Ginger Rogers

text: It's the game of life. Do I win or do I lose? One day they're gonna shut the game down. I gotta have as much fun and go around the board as many times as I can before it's my turn to leave.
author: Tupac Shakur

text: There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept the responsibility for changing them.
author: Denis Waitley

text: I love life because what more is there?
author: Anthony Hopkins

text: Once you say you're going to settle for second, that's what happens to you in life.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Confucius

text: One secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

text: We only live once, but once is enough if we do it right. Live your life with class, dignity, and style so that an exclamation, rather than a question mark signifies it!
author: Gary Ryan Blair

text: When I chased after money, I never had enough. When I got my life on purpose and focused on giving of myself and everything that arrived into my life, then I was prosperous.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Miracles, in the sense of phenomena we cannot explain, surround us on every hand: life itself is the miracle of miracles.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Too often in life, something happens and we blame other people for us not being happy or satisfied or fulfilled. So the point is, we all have choices, and we make the choice to accept people or situations or to not accept situations.
author: Tom Brady

text: Very little is needed to make a happy life it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: I never thought of losing, but now that it' s happened, the only thing is to do it right. That's my obligation to all the people who believe in me. We all have to take defeats in life.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I remember a specific moment, watching my grandmother hang the clothes on the line, and her saying to me, 'you are going to have to learn to do this,' and me being in that space of awareness and knowing that my life would not be the same as my grandmother's life.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: What is important in life is life, and not the result of life.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Life is the flower for which love is the honey.
author: Victor Hugo

text: To me, if life boils down to one thing, it's movement. To live is to keep moving.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

text: All my life I have tried to pluck a thistle and plant a flower wherever the flower would grow in thought and mind.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Respect is one of life's greatest treasures. I mean, what does it all add up to if you don't have that?
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: I've always taken 'The Wizard of Oz' very seriously, you know. I believe in the idea of the rainbow. And I've spent my entire life trying to get over it.
author: Judy Garland

text: I want to live my life so that my nights are not full of regrets.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

text: Never separate the life you live from the words you speak.
author: Paul Wellstone

text: I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

text: The things that will destroy America are prosperity-at-any-price, peace-at-any-price, safety-first instead of duty-first, the love of soft living, and the get-rich-quick theory of life.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Every man regards his own life as the New Year's Eve of time.
author: Jean Paul

text: Life is made up of sobs, sniffles, and smiles, with sniffles predominating.
author: O. Henry

text: Without deep reflection one knows from daily life that one exists for other people.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Yes, you can lose somebody overnight, yes, your whole life can be turned upside down. Life is short. It can come and go like a feather in the wind.
author: Shania Twain

text: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.
author: Alfred Adler

text: Money isn't the most important thing in life, but it's reasonably close to oxygen on the 'gotta have it' scale.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Wars and elections are both too big and too small to matter in the long run. The daily work - that goes on, it adds up.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

text: Life is like a trumpet - if you don't put anything into it, you don't get anything out of it.
author: William Christopher Handy

text: We must be willing to let go of the life we have planned, so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
author: E. M. Forster

text: There is a very fine line between loving life and being greedy for it.
author: Maya Angelou

text: I believe this with all my heart: The greatest coach of all time in my eyes is my mom. She's instilled in me a toughness and a perseverance and just a never-quit mentality, and I thank her every day for providing me, for what she sacrificed her life for.
author: Scott Brooks

text: You are doomed to make choices. This is life's greatest paradox.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: I have so much chaos in my life, it's become normal. You become used to it. You have to just relax, calm down, take a deep breath and try to see how you can make things work rather than complain about how they're wrong.
author: Tom Welling

text: Life is not what it's supposed to be. It's what it is. The way you cope with it is what makes the difference.
author: Virginia Satir

text: Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile.
author: Albert Einstein

text: It is better to create than to learn! Creating is the essence of life.
author: Julius Caesar

text: Everything has been figured out, except how to live.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

text: I bear a charmed life.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

text: A life of leisure and a life of laziness are two things. There will be sleeping enough in the grave.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The key to immortality is first living a life worth remembering.
author: Bruce Lee

text: A well-spent day brings happy sleep.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: The goal of life is to make your heartbeat match the beat of the universe, to match your nature with Nature.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word happy would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness. It is far better take things as they come along with patience and equanimity.
author: Carl Jung

text: Life is largely a matter of expectation.
author: Horace

text: Every day is a new opportunity. You can build on yesterday's success or put its failures behind and start over again. That's the way life is, with a new game every day, and that's the way baseball is.
author: Bob Feller

text: Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Life is a succession of moments, to live each one is to succeed.
author: Corita Kent

text: Life is wasted on the living.
author: Douglas Adams

text: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Take a chance! All life is a chance. The man who goes farthest is generally the one who is willing to do and dare.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: I lost my sense of trust, honesty and compassion. I crashed down and became what I consider an emotional mess. I've never been so miserable in my whole life. I just wanted to go to bed and never get up.
author: Shania Twain

text: If you always put limit on everything you do, physical or anything else. It will spread into your work and into your life. There are no limits. There are only plateaus, and you must not stay there, you must go beyond them.
author: Bruce Lee

text: When you are tough on yourself, life is going to be infinitely easier on you.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Waste your money and you're only out of money, but waste your time and you've lost a part of your life.
author: Michael LeBoeuf

text: Love is life. And if you miss love, you miss life.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: I don't believe in guilt, I believe in living on impulse as long as you never intentionally hurt another person, and don't judge people in your life. I think you should live completely free.
author: Angelina Jolie

text: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them - that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Life is truly known only to those who suffer, lose, endure adversity and stumble from defeat to defeat.
author: Anais Nin

text: You must understand the whole of life, not just one little part of it. That is why you must read, that is why you must look at the skies, that is why you must sing and dance, and write poems and suffer and understand, for all that is life.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: The most important thing is to enjoy your life - to be happy - it's all that matters.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: A broad margin of leisure is as beautiful in a man's life as in a book. Haste makes waste, no less in life than in housekeeping. Keep the time, observe the hours of the universe, not of the cars.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Let the refining and improving of your own life keep you so busy that you have little time to criticize others.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

text: It is not doing the thing we like to do, but liking the thing we have to do, that makes life blessed.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: There are four questions of value in life... What is sacred? Of what is the spirit made? What is worth living for, and what is worth dying for? The answer to each is the same. Only love.
author: Johnny Depp

text: When it comes to life the critical thing is whether you take things for granted or take them with gratitude.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

text: Words can never adequately convey the incredible impact of our attitudes toward life. The longer I live the more convinced I become that life is 10 percent what happens to us and 90 percent how we respond to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

text: Telling a teenager the facts of life is like giving a fish a bath.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

text: You cannot tailor-make the situations in life but you can tailor-make the attitudes to fit those situations.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life define yourself.
author: Harvey Fierstein

text: It takes half your life before you discover life is a do-it-yourself project.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: Without knowing what I am and why I am here, life is impossible.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Babies don't need a vacation, but I still see them at the beach... it pisses me off! I'll go over to a little baby and say 'What are you doing here? You haven't worked a day in your life!'
author: Steven Wright

text: Acceptance of one's life has nothing to do with resignation it does not mean running away from the struggle. On the contrary, it means accepting it as it comes, with all the handicaps of heredity, of suffering, of psychological complexes and injustices.
author: Paul Tournier

text: I am sorry to say that there is too much point to the wisecrack that life is extinct on other planets because their scientists were more advanced than ours.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Music washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
author: Berthold Auerbach

text: I don't think you ever stop giving. I really don't. I think it's an on-going process. And it's not just about being able to write a check. It's being able to touch somebody's life.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: I just don't know how to deal with so many people giving me that much affection. I never had that in my life.
author: Tupac Shakur

text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Life lived for tomorrow will always be just a day away from being realized.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: If there's not drama and negativity in my life, all my songs will be really wack and boring or something.
author: Eminem

text: Children are the anchors of a mother's life.
author: Sophocles

text: We need to give each other the space to grow, to be ourselves, to exercise our diversity. We need to give each other space so that we may both give and receive such beautiful things as ideas, openness, dignity, joy, healing, and inclusion.
author: Max de Pree

text: The world is very different now. For man holds in his mortal hands the power to abolish all forms of human poverty, and all forms of human life.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Trust yourself. Create the kind of self that you will be happy to live with all your life. Make the most of yourself by fanning the tiny, inner sparks of possibility into flames of achievement.
author: Golda Meir

text: Give me the luxuries of life and I will willingly do without the necessities.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

text: There are only two tragedies in life: one is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I would say my greatest achievement in life right now - my greatest achievement period is - and I'm still trying to achieve it - is to be a wonderful father to my kids.
author: Bo Jackson

text: Life is to be lived. If you have to support yourself, you had bloody well better find some way that is going to be interesting. And you don't do that by sitting around.
author: Katharine Hepburn

text: I never did a day's work in my life. It was all fun.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: Above our life we love a steadfast friend.
author: Christopher Marlowe

text: It is normal to give away a little of one's life in order not to lose it all.
author: Albert Camus

text: I blame my mother for my poor sex life. All she told me was 'the man goes on top and the woman underneath.' For three years my husband and I slept in bunk beds.
author: Joan Rivers

text: Character, in the long run, is the decisive factor in the life of an individual and of nations alike.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Choice of attention - to pay attention to this and ignore that - is to the inner life what choice of action is to the outer. In both cases, a man is responsible for his choice and must accept the consequences, whatever they may be.
author: W. H. Auden

text: There is always inequality in life. Some men are killed in a war and some men are wounded and some men never leave the country. Life is unfair.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: The basic fact about human existence is not that it is a tragedy, but that it is a bore. It is not so much a war as an endless standing in line.
author: H. L. Mencken

text: Frazier is so ugly that he should donate his face to the US Bureau of Wild Life.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I want to be thoroughly used up when I die, for the harder I work the more I live. I rejoice in life for its own sake.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: The chief reason for going to school is to get the impression fixed for life that there is a book side for everything.
author: Robert Frost

text: You will find as you look back upon your life that the moments when you have truly lived are the moments when you have done things in the spirit of love.
author: Henry Drummond

text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
author: Charles Darwin

text: There are two tragedies in life. One is to lose your heart's desire. The other is to gain it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: As a remedy to life in society I would suggest the big city. Nowadays, it is the only desert within our means.
author: Albert Camus

text: Whatever you do in life, surround yourself with smart people who'll argue with you.
author: John Wooden

text: If there is only one thing in my life that I am proud of, it's that I've never been a kept woman.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: We continue to shape our personality all our life. If we knew ourselves perfectly, we should die.
author: Albert Camus

text: There is nothing more tragic than to find an individual bogged down in the length of life, devoid of breadth.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: Man does not control his own fate. The women in his life do that for him.
author: Groucho Marx

text: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.
author: William James

text: Life has its own hidden forces which you can only discover by living.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

text: I am an example of what is possible when girls from the very beginning of their lives are loved and nurtured by people around them. I was surrounded by extraordinary women in my life who taught me about quiet strength and dignity.
author: Michelle Obama

text: Life's Tragedy is that we get old to soon and wise too late.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own in the midst of abundance.
author: Buddha

text: If you are lucky enough to have lived in Paris as a young man, then wherever you go for the rest of your life it stays with you, for Paris is a moveable feast.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: I really believe that everyone has a talent, ability, or skill that he can mine to support himself and to succeed in life.
author: Dean Koontz

text: You can have everything in life you want, if you will just help other people get what they want.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: You have to take risks. We will only understand the miracle of life fully when we allow the unexpected to happen.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Ships that pass in the night, and speak each other in passing, only a signal shown, and a distant voice in the darkness So on the ocean of life, we pass and speak one another, only a look and a voice, then darkness again and a silence.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

text: Always fall in with what you're asked to accept. Take what is given, and make it over your way. My aim in life has always been to hold my own with whatever's going. Not against: with.
author: Robert Frost

text: My life is every moment of my life. It is not a culmination of the past.
author: Hugh Leonard

text: Be patient and understanding. Life is too short to be vengeful or malicious.
author: Phillips Brooks

text: Poetry is a way of taking life by the throat.
author: Robert Frost

text: Every man dies. Not every man really lives.
author: William Wallace

text: I'm not one of those complicated, mixed-up cats. I'm not looking for the secret to life... I just go on from day to day, taking what comes.
author: Frank Sinatra

text: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Extend to them all the care, kindness and understanding you can muster, and do it with no thought of any reward. Your life will never be the same again.
author: Og Mandino

text: This is as true in everyday life as it is in battle: we are given one life and the decision is ours whether to wait for circumstances to make up our mind, or whether to act, and in acting, to live.
author: Omar N. Bradley

text: The purpose of life is a life of purpose.
author: Robert Byrne

text: Being taken for granted can be a compliment. It means that you've become a comfortable, trusted element in another person's life.
author: Joyce Brothers

text: Friends are as companions on a journey, who ought to aid each other to persevere in the road to a happier life.
author: Pythagoras

text: Life is a song - sing it. Life is a game - play it. Life is a challenge - meet it. Life is a dream - realize it. Life is a sacrifice - offer it. Life is love - enjoy it.
author: Sai Baba

text: Once you've wrestled, everything else in life is easy.
author: Dan Gable

text: Cease trying to work everything out with your minds. It will get you nowhere. Live by intuition and inspiration and let your whole life be Revelation.
author: Eileen Caddy

text: Life is short and we have never too much time for gladdening the hearts of those who are travelling the dark journey with us. Oh be swift to love, make haste to be kind.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

text: There is just one life for each of us: our own.
author: Euripides

text: Life loves the liver of it.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Life is not easy for any of us. But what of that? We must have perseverance and above all confidence in ourselves. We must believe that we are gifted for something and that this thing must be attained.
author: Marie Curie

text: Children make your life important.
author: Erma Bombeck

text: I love sleep. My life has the tendency to fall apart when I'm awake, you know?
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: We are here to add what we can to life, not to get what we can from life.
author: William Osler

text: Life well spent is long.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Love is the greatest refreshment in life.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: I do not believe in excuses. I believe in hard work as the prime solvent of life's problems.
author: James Cash Penney

text: Being in control of your life and having realistic expectations about your day-to-day challenges are the keys to stress management, which is perhaps the most important ingredient to living a happy, healthy and rewarding life.
author: Marilu Henner

text: You leave old habits behind by starting out with the thought, 'I release the need for this in my life'.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: For if there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life and in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
author: Albert Camus

text: Life is just one damned thing after another.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: I swear, by my life and my love of it, that I will never live for the sake of another man, nor ask another man to live for mine.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Once in his life, every man is entitled to fall madly in love with a gorgeous redhead.
author: Lucille Ball

text: The indispensable first step to getting the things you want out of life is this: decide what you want.
author: Ben Stein

text: Your children are not your children. They are the sons and daughters of Life's longing for itself. They came through you but not from you and though they are with you yet they belong not to you.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: My guiding principles in life are to be honest, genuine, thoughtful and caring.
author: Prince William

text: Life is as tedious as twice-told tale, vexing the dull ear of a drowsy man.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Life is without meaning. You bring the meaning to it. The meaning of life is whatever you ascribe it to be. Being alive is the meaning.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: We must declare ourselves, become known allow the world to discover this subterranean life of ours which connects kings and farm boys, artists and clerks. Let them see that the important thing is not the object of love, but the emotion itself.
author: Gore Vidal

text: Difficult times have helped me to understand better than before, how infinitely rich and beautiful life is in every way, and that so many things that one goes worrying about are of no importance whatsoever.
author: Isak Dinesen

text: It is not length of life, but depth of life.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The more sand that has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
author: Jean Paul

text: Time is the coin of your life. It is the only coin you have, and only you can determine how it will be spent. Be careful lest you let other people spend it for you.
author: Carl Sandburg

text: The main purpose of life is to live rightly, think rightly, act rightly. The soul must languish when we give all our thought to the body.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The meaning of life is contained in every single expression of life. It is present in the infinity of forms and phenomena that exist in all of creation.
author: Michael Jackson

text: Life loves to be taken by the lapel and told: 'I'm with you kid. Let's go.'
author: Maya Angelou

text: I have found it easier to identify with the characters who verge upon hysteria, who were frightened of life, who were desperate to reach out to another person. But these seemingly fragile people are the strong people really.
author: Tennessee Williams

text: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Life is what happens while you are busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: I'm not claiming divinity. I've never claimed purity of soul. I've never claimed to have the answers to life. I only put out songs and answer questions as honestly as I can... But I still believe in peace, love and understanding.
author: John Lennon

text: Let love flow so that it cleanses the world. Then man can live in peace, instead of the state of turmoil he has created through his past ways of life, with all those material interests and earthly ambitions.
author: Sai Baba

text: When I was young I thought that money was the most important thing in life now that I am old I know that it is.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: My mother wanted us to understand that the tragedies of your life one day have the potential to be comic stories the next.
author: Nora Ephron

text: The greatest pleasure of life is love.
author: Euripides

text: Open your eyes, look within. Are you satisfied with the life you're living?
author: Bob Marley

text: Everyone has his own specific vocation or mission in life everyone must carry out a concrete assignment that demands fulfillment. Therein he cannot be replaced, nor can his life be repeated, thus, everyone's task is unique as his specific opportunity to implement it.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

text: He who fights with monsters might take care lest he thereby become a monster. Is not life a hundred times too short for us to bore ourselves?
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Human life is as evanescent as the morning dew or a flash of lightning.
author: Samuel Butler

text: Without music, life would be a mistake.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: As soon as there is life there is danger.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: For the happiest life, days should be rigorously planned, nights left open to chance.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

text: Life itself is the proper binge.
author: Julia Child

text: Most of the luxuries and many of the so-called comforts of life are not only not indispensable, but positive hindrances to the elevation of mankind.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: You have succeeded in life when all you really want is only what you really need.
author: Vernon Howard

text: How far you go in life depends on your being tender with the young, compassionate with the aged, sympathetic with the striving and tolerant of the weak and strong. Because someday in your life you will have been all of these.
author: George Washington Carver

text: Life has meaning only if one barters it day by day for something other than itself.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

text: Life stands before me like an eternal spring with new and brilliant clothes.
author: Carl Friedrich Gauss

text: If you are not too long, I will wait here for you all my life.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I haven't trusted polls since I read that 62% of women had affairs during their lunch hour. I've never met a woman in my life who would give up lunch for sex.
author: Erma Bombeck

text: Life is what we make it, always has been, always will be.
author: Grandma Moses

text: Focusing your life solely on making a buck shows a certain poverty of ambition. It asks too little of yourself. Because it's only when you hitch your wagon to something larger than yourself that you realize your true potential.
author: Barack Obama

text: It's not the men in my life that count, it's the life in my men.
author: Mae West

text: People disparage knowing and the intellectual life, and urge doing. I am content with knowing, if only I could know.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: To be able to look back upon ones life in satisfaction, is to live twice.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: Life becomes harder for us when we live for others, but it also becomes richer and happier.
author: Albert Schweitzer

text: I have a simple philosophy: Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. Scratch where it itches.
author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

text: It's better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.
author: Elizabeth Kenny

text: As you walk down the fairway of life you must smell the roses, for you only get to play one round.
author: Ben Hogan

text: A man who has been the indisputable favorite of his mother keeps for life the feeling of a conqueror.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: So if you stay ready, you ain't gotta get ready, and that is how I run my life.
author: Will Smith

text: People have a moral standard about what they will do and will not do. At the end of the day someone who cheats has a lower moral standard than someone who does not. And they will cheat in other areas of life as well.
author: Carl Lewis

text: To affect the quality of the day, that is the highest of arts.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Life is thickly sown with thorns, and I know no other remedy than to pass quickly through them. The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.
author: Voltaire

text: To be free is to have achieved your life.
author: Tennessee Williams

text: I've failed over and over and over again in my life and that is why I succeed.
author: Michael Jordan

text: An aim in life is the only fortune worth finding.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: I need drama in my life to keep making music.
author: Eminem

text: About all you can do in life is be who you are. Some people will love you for you. Most will love you for what you can do for them, and some won't like you at all.
author: Rita Mae Brown

text: The purpose of human life is to serve, and to show compassion and the will to help others.
author: Albert Schweitzer

text: One thing they never tell you about child raising is that for the rest of your life, at the drop of a hat, you are expected to know your child's name and how old he or she is.
author: Erma Bombeck

text: The lie is a condition of life.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: All my life I've looked at words as though I were seeing them for the first time.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: The whole secret of life is to be interested in one thing profoundly and in a thousand things well.
author: Horace Walpole

text: Sometimes I feel my whole life has been one big rejection.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: I have a lot of things to prove to myself. One is that I can live my life fearlessly.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: While we have the gift of life, it seems to me the only tragedy is to allow part of us to die - whether it is our spirit, our creativity or our glorious uniqueness.
author: Gilda Radner

text: I guess I have always been deeply terrified to really be someone's wife since I know from life one cannot love another, ever, really.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: I challenge you to make your life a masterpiece. I challenge you to join the ranks of those people who live what they teach, who walk their talk.
author: Tony Robbins

text: To deprive a man of his natural liberty and to deny to him the ordinary amenities of life is worse then starving the body it is starvation of the soul, the dweller in the body.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: One of the secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others.
author: Lewis Carroll

text: We have the duty to protect the life of an unborn child.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: Whatever your life's work is, do it well. A man should do his job so well that the living, the dead, and the unborn could do it no better.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: Not a shred of evidence exists in favor of the idea that life is serious.
author: Brendan Gill

text: There are old heads in the world who cannot help me by their example or advice to live worthily and satisfactorily to myself but I believe that it is in my power to elevate myself this very hour above the common level of my life.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

text: Life is all memory, except for the one present moment that goes by you so quickly you hardly catch it going.
author: Tennessee Williams

text: A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives.
author: Jackie Robinson

text: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
author: Socrates

text: I'm back to doing everything I used to, loving life as ever.
author: Donna Mills

text: Two such as you with such a master speed, cannot be parted nor be swept away, from one another once you are agreed, that life is only life forevermore, together wing to wing and oar to oar.
author: Robert Frost

text: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Men create gods after their own image, not only with regard to their form but with regard to their mode of life.
author: Aristotle

text: As we advance in life it becomes more and more difficult, but in fighting the difficulties the inmost strength of the heart is developed.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

text: Your daily life is your temple and your religion. When you enter into it take with you your all.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: There are moments in life, when the heart is so full of emotion That if by chance it be shaken, or into its depths like a pebble Drops some careless word, it overflows, and its secret, Spilt on the ground like water, can never be gathered together.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

text: When you have nobody you can make a cup of tea for, when nobody needs you, that's when I think life is over.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: At the end of your life, you will never regret not having passed one more test, not winning one more verdict or not closing one more deal. You will regret time not spent with a husband, a friend, a child, or a parent.
author: Barbara Bush

text: Life begins at the end of your comfort zone.
author: Neale Donald Walsch

text: What material success does is provide you with the ability to concentrate on other things that really matter. And that is being able to make a difference, not only in your own life, but in other people's lives.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: May you live all the days of your life.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: The expectations of life depend upon diligence the mechanic that would perfect his work must first sharpen his tools.
author: Confucius

text: There is a vitality, a life force, an energy, a quickening, that is translated through you into action, and because there is only one of you in all time, this expression is unique.
author: Martha Graham

text: This life is worth living, we can say, since it is what we make it.
author: William James

text: All life demands struggle. Those who have everything given to them become lazy, selfish, and insensitive to the real values of life. The very striving and hard work that we so constantly try to avoid is the major building block in the person we are today.
author: Pope Paul VI

text: Life is a mirror and will reflect back to the thinker what he thinks into it.
author: Ernest Holmes

text: I have learned that success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has had to overcome while trying to succeed.
author: Booker T. Washington

text: I'm the one that has to die when it's time for me to die, so let me live my life, the way I want to.

text: Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first.
author: Mark Twain

text: I don't have expectations. Expectations in your life just lead to giant disappointments.
author: Michael Landon

text: Books constitute capital. A library book lasts as long as a house, for hundreds of years. It is not, then, an article of mere consumption but fairly of capital, and often in the case of professional men, setting out in life, it is their only capital.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: He who binds to himself a joy Does the winged life destroy But he who kisses the joy as it flies Lives in eternity's sun rise.
author: William Blake

text: Make it a habit to tell people thank you. To express your appreciation, sincerely and without the expectation of anything in return. Truly appreciate those around you, and you'll soon find many others around you. Truly appreciate life, and you'll find that you have more of it.
author: Ralph Marston

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: Regarding life, the wisest men of all ages have judged alike: it is worthless.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The key to success is to keep growing in all areas of life - mental, emotional, spiritual, as well as physical.
author: Julius Erving

text: Man is subject to innumerable pains and sorrows by the very condition of humanity, and yet, as if nature had not sown evils enough in life, we are continually adding grief to grief and aggravating the common calamity by our cruel treatment of one another.
author: Joseph Addison

text: What a wonderful life I've had! I only wish I'd realized it sooner.
author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

text: Let everyone try and find that as a result of daily prayer he adds something new to his life, something with which nothing can be compared.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: In life you need either inspiration or desperation.
author: Tony Robbins

text: A life is either all spiritual or not spiritual at all. No man can serve two masters. Your life is shaped by the end you live for. You are made in the image of what you desire.
author: Thomas Merton

text: You see, in life, lots of people know what to do, but few people actually do what they know. Knowing is not enough! You must take action.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Life must be lived and curiosity kept alive. One must never, for whatever reason, turn his back on life.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The greatest mistake you can make in life is continually fearing that you'll make one.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Life is lived on the edge.
author: Will Smith

text: There are people who want to make men's lives more difficult for no other reason than the chance it provides them afterwards to offer their prescription for alleviating life their Christianity, for instance.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: If you live long enough, you'll make mistakes. But if you learn from them, you'll be a better person. It's how you handle adversity, not how it affects you. The main thing is never quit, never quit, never quit.
author: William J. Clinton

text: Run for your life from any man who tells you that money is evil. That sentence is the leper's bell of an approaching looter.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Religion is more than life. Remember that his own religion is the truest to every man even if it stands low in the scales of philosophical comparison.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: I think I've discovered the secret of life - you just hang around until you get used to it.
author: Charles M. Schulz

text: The man who has no inner-life is a slave to his surroundings.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

text: Life is not fair get used to it.
author: Bill Gates

text: There is no more fatal blunderer than he who consumes the greater part of his life getting his living.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Life is a tragedy when seen in close-up, but a comedy in long-shot.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: It is one of the beautiful compensations in this life that no one can sincerely try to help another without helping himself.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Don't let life discourage you everyone who got where he is had to begin where he was.
author: Richard L. Evans

text: There is no force like success, and that is why the individual makes all effort to surround himself throughout life with the evidence of it as of the individual, so should it be of the nation.
author: Marcus Garvey

text: Somebody should tell us, right at the start of our lives, that we are dying. Then we might live life to the limit, every minute of every day. Do it! I say. Whatever you want to do, do it now! There are only so many tomorrows.
author: Pope Paul VI

text: To know nothing is the happiest life.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

text: My advice to people today is as follows: if you take the game of life seriously, if you take your nervous system seriously, if you take your sense organs seriously, if you take the energy process seriously, you must turn on, tune in, and drop out.
author: Timothy Leary

text: Life is very interesting... in the end, some of your greatest pains, become your greatest strengths.
author: Drew Barrymore

text: Some of the worst mistakes of my life have been haircuts.
author: Jim Morrison

text: I wanted to write about the moment when your addictions no longer hide the truth from you. When your whole life breaks down. That's the moment when you have to somehow choose what your life is going to be about.

text: In college I never realized the opportunities available to a pro athlete. I've been given the chance to meet all kinds of people, to travel and expand my financial capabilities, to get ideas and learn about life, to create a world apart from basketball.
author: Michael Jordan

text: Most people have never learned that one of the main aims in life is to enjoy it.
author: Samuel Butler

text: Beware the barrenness of a busy life.
author: Socrates

text: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.
author: Joan of Arc

text: Never build your emotional life on the weaknesses of others.
author: George Santayana

text: If you can dream it, then you can achieve it. You will get all you want in life if you help enough other people get what they want.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

text: It is a common saying, and in everybody's mouth, that life is but a sojourn.
author: Plato

text: Here is the test to find whether your mission on Earth is finished: if you're alive, it isn't.
author: Richard Bach

text: You can't make positive choices for the rest of your life without an environment that makes those choices easy, natural, and enjoyable.
