text: The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Television is not real life. In real life people actually have to leave the coffee shop and go to jobs.
author: Bill Gates

text: My trust in a higher power that wants me to survive and have love in my life, is what keeps me moving forward.
author: Kenny Loggins

text: The less routine the more life.
author: Amos Bronson Alcott

text: We don't get a chance to do that many things, and every one should be really excellent. Because this is our life. Life is brief, and then you die, you know? So this is what we've chosen to do with our life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Sometimes, I feel like one who is on the sidelines, who has missed life itself.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The world has grown suspicious of anything that looks like a happily married life.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: One way to get the most out of life is to look upon it as an adventure.
author: William Feather

text: Any life is made up of a single moment, the moment in which a man finds out, once and for all, who he is.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

text: Accept responsibility for your life. Know that it is you who will get you where you want to go, no one else.
author: Les Brown

text: To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: We can always choose to perceive things differently. You can focus on what's wrong in your life, or you can focus on what's right.
author: Marianne Williamson

text: Life isn't a matter of milestones, but of moments.
author: Rose Kennedy

text: We love life, not because we are used to living but because we are used to loving.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: What they're not ready for is guys like you and I and Nails and all the other gnarly gnarlingtons in my life, that we are high priests, Vatican assassin warlocks. Boom. Print that, people. See where that goes.
author: Charlie Sheen

text: To lengthen thy life, lessen thy meals.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: A life lived with integrity - even if it lacks the trappings of fame and fortune is a shining star in whose light others may follow in the years to come.
author: Denis Waitley

text: Every man's life ends the same way. It is only the details of how he lived and how he died that distinguish one man from another.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: It is a bit embarrassing to have been concerned with the human problem all one's life and find at the end that one has no more to offer by way of advice than 'try to be a little kinder.'
author: Aldous Huxley

text: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
author: Plato

text: Don't go through life, grow through life.
author: Eric Butterworth

text: Polygamy: An endeavour to get more out of life than there is in it.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: I have inspiration and feelings of being alive most every day I live.
author: Judy Collins

text: You do things when the opportunities come along. I've had periods in my life when I've had a bundle of ideas come along, and I've had long dry spells. If I get an idea next week, I'll do something. If not, I won't do a damn thing.
author: Warren Buffett

text: The true object of all human life is play. Earth is a task garden heaven is a playground.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

text: The major value in life is not what you get. The major value in life is what you become.
author: Jim Rohn

text: I put all my genius into my life I put only my talent into my works.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Our prime purpose in this life is to help others. And if you can't help them, at least don't hurt them.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Life has a higher end, than to be amused.
author: William Ellery Channing

text: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
author: Aristotle

text: Life consists in what a man is thinking of all day.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: I love those who yearn for the impossible.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: You can never really live anyone else's life, not even your child's. The influence you exert is through your own life, and what you've become yourself.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Success comes from taking the initiative and following up... persisting... eloquently expressing the depth of your love. What simple action could you take today to produce a new momentum toward success in your life?
author: Tony Robbins

text: The aim of life is to live, and to live means to be aware, joyously, drunkenly, serenely, divinely aware.
author: Henry Miller

text: Life is like dancing. If we have a big floor, many people will dance. Some will get angry when the rhythm changes. But life is changing all the time.
author: Miguel Angel Ruiz

text: Life is but thought.
author: Sara Teasdale

text: I'm a heroine addict. I need to have sex with women who have saved someone's life.
author: Mitch Hedberg

text: My rule of life prescribed as an absolutely sacred rite smoking cigars and also the drinking of alcohol before, after and if need be during all meals and in the intervals between them.
author: Winston Churchill

text: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
author: Christopher Morley

text: This is the strangest life I've ever known.
author: Jim Morrison

text: When life is too easy for us, we must beware or we may not be ready to meet the blows which sooner or later come to everyone, rich or poor.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Life is a long lesson in humility.
author: James M. Barrie

text: Life itself still remains a very effective therapist.
author: Karen Horney

text: There is only one thing in life worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Today, more than ever before, life must be characterized by a sense of Universal responsibility, not only nation to nation and human to human, but also human to other forms of life.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Kindness, I've discovered, is everything in life.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

text: Every creature is better alive than dead, men and moose and pine trees, and he who understands it aright will rather preserve its life than destroy it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: When I hear somebody sigh, 'Life is hard,' I am always tempted to ask, 'Compared to what?'
author: Sydney J. Harris

text: Variety's the very spice of life, That gives it all its flavor.
author: William Cowper

text: Life is anything that dies when you stomp on it.
author: Dave Barry

text: Property is intended to serve life, and no matter how much we surround it with rights and respect, it has no personal being. It is part of the earth man walks on. It is not man.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: I still find each day too short for all the thoughts I want to think, all the walks I want to take, all the books I want to read, and all the friends I want to see.
author: John Burroughs

text: Autobiographies are only useful as the lives you read about and analyze may suggest to you something that you may find useful in your own journey through life.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: A person will sometimes devote all his life to the development of one part of his body - the wishbone.
author: Robert Frost

text: Life is 10 percent what you make it, and 90 percent how you take it.
author: Irving Berlin

text: You can't live your life blaming your failures on your parents and what they did or didn't do for you. You're dealt the cards that you're dealt. I realised it was a waste of time to be angry at my parents and feel sorry for myself.
author: Drew Barrymore

text: The personal life deeply lived always expands into truths beyond itself.
author: Anais Nin

text: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life.
author: Marcus Garvey

text: Where there is love there is life.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: My focus is to forget the pain of life. Forget the pain, mock the pain, reduce it. And laugh.
author: Jim Carrey

text: If you ask me what I came into this life to do, I will tell you: I came to live out loud.
author: Emile Zola

text: Develop an interest in life as you see it the people, things, literature, music - the world is so rich, simply throbbing with rich treasures, beautiful souls and interesting people. Forget yourself.
author: Henry Miller

text: Find ecstasy in life the mere sense of living is joy enough.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: A chain is no stronger than its weakest link, and life is after all a chain.
author: William James

text: I'm not an example for how people should live their lives. Never in my life would I ever set out to be an example for people on how to live their lives. If you need an example for how to live, then you just shouldn't have been born. Straight up.
author: Lil Wayne

text: Man's real life is happy, chiefly because he is ever expecting that it soon will be so.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: Each person must live their life as a model for others.
author: Rosa Parks

text: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
author: Helen Keller

text: Life is much shorter than I imagined it to be.
author: Abraham Cahan

text: Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity, or registering wrongs.
author: Charlotte Bronte

text: The highest use of capital is not to make more money, but to make money do more for the betterment of life.
author: Henry Ford

text: Today is life-the only life you are sure of. Make the most of today. Get interested in something. Shake yourself awake. Develop a hobby. Let the winds of enthusiasm sweep through you. Live today with gusto.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: The secret of life is honesty and fair dealing. If you can fake that, you've got it made.
author: Groucho Marx

text: Life is a moderately good play with a badly written third act.
author: Truman Capote

text: The story of life is quicker then the blink of an eye, the story of love is hello, goodbye.
author: Jimi Hendrix

text: Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: I just got one last thing, I urge all of you, all of you, to enjoy your life, the precious moments you have. To spend each day with some laughter and some thought, to get you're emotions going.
author: Jim Valvano

text: Life's like a movie, write your own ending. Keep believing, keep pretending.
author: Jim Henson

text: All my life, my heart has yearned for a thing I cannot name.
author: Andre Breton

text: Our life is frittered away by detail... simplify, simplify.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The monotony and solitude of a quiet life stimulates the creative mind.
author: Albert Einstein

text: What you get is a living, what you give is a life.
author: Lillian Gish

text: The man who views the world at 50 the same as he did at 20 has wasted 30 years of his life.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Becoming a father, I think it inevitably changes your perspective of life. I don't get nearly enough sleep. And the simplest things in life are completely satisfying. I find you don't have to do as much, like you don't go on as many outings.
author: Hugh Jackman

text: To live is so startling it leaves little time for anything else.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: When we remember we are all mad, the mysteries disappear and life stands explained.
author: Mark Twain

text: Wrong life cannot be lived rightly.
author: Theodor Adorno

text: For the meaning of life differs from man to man, from day to day and from hour to hour. What matters, therefore, is not the meaning of life in general but rather the specific meaning of a person's life at a given moment.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

text: Life began with waking up and loving my mother's face.
author: George Eliot

text: We can't plan life. All we can do is be available for it.
author: Lauryn Hill

text: Do every act of your life as if it were your last.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The ultimate value of life depends upon awareness and the power of contemplation rather than upon mere survival.
author: Aristotle

text: To expect too much is to have a sentimental view of life and this is a softness that ends in bitterness.
author: Flannery O'Connor

text: Not by appointment do we meet delight Or joy they heed not our expectancy But round some corner of the streets of life they of a sudden greet us with a smile.
author: Gerald Massey

text: A man sooner or later discovers that he is the master-gardener of his soul, the director of his life.
author: James Allen

text: One's real life is so often the life that one does not lead.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Any idiot can face a crisis - it's day to day living that wears you out.
author: Anton Chekhov

text: Alcohol is the anesthesia by which we endure the operation of life.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Nothing in life is so exhilarating as to be shot at without result.
author: Winston Churchill

text: There is more to life than increasing its speed.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: It's surprising how many persons go through life without ever recognizing that their feelings toward other people are largely determined by their feelings toward themselves, and if you're not comfortable within yourself, you can't be comfortable with others.
author: Sydney J. Harris

text: Thug Life to me is dead.
author: Tupac Shakur

text: I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter.
author: Walt Disney

text: Fortunately analysis is not the only way to resolve inner conflicts. Life itself still remains a very effective therapist.
author: Karen Horney

text: With an eye made quiet by the power of harmony, and the deep power of joy, we see into the life of things.
author: William Wordsworth

text: Keep your eyes open to your mercies. The man who forgets to be thankful has fallen asleep in life.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: For me life is continuously being hungry. The meaning of life is not simply to exist, to survive, but to move ahead, to go up, to achieve, to conquer.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

text: I remember my mother's prayers and they have always followed me. They have clung to me all my life.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Everything in life is luck.
author: Donald Trump

text: Every life has a measure of sorrow, and sometimes this is what awakens us.
author: Steven Tyler

text: He who is void of virtuous attachments in private life is, or very soon will be, void of all regard for his country. There is seldom an instance of a man guilty of betraying his country, who had not before lost the feeling of moral obligations in his private connections.
author: Samuel Adams

text: The value of life lies not in the length of days, but in the use we make of them... Whether you find satisfaction in life depends not on your tale of years, but on your will.
author: Michel de Montaigne

text: To succeed in life, you need two things: ignorance and confidence.
author: Mark Twain

text: I made a mistake by being ejected from the presidency. Next time, I will choose a Cabinet which will allow me to be life President.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Our life always expresses the result of our dominant thoughts.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

text: Having Down syndrome is like being born normal. I am just like you and you are just like me. We are all born in different ways, that is the way I can describe it. I have a normal life.
author: Chris Burke

text: The greatest day in your life and mine is when we take total responsibility for our attitudes. That's the day we truly grow up.
author: John C. Maxwell

text: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.
author: Booker T. Washington

text: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: There is no wealth but life.
author: John Ruskin

text: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: A dog will teach you unconditional love. If you can have that in your life, things won't be too bad.
author: Robert Wagner

text: The truth is you don't know what is going to happen tomorrow. Life is a crazy ride, and nothing is guaranteed.
author: Eminem

text: Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back by becoming more.
author: Tony Robbins

text: My definition of success is to live your life in a way that causes you to feel a ton of pleasure and very little pain - and because of your lifestyle, have the people around you feel a lot more pleasure than they do pain.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Nature and human life are as various as our several constitutions. Who shall say what prospect life offers to another?
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: While we are postponing, life speeds by.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

text: At times in my life the only place I have been happy is when I am on stage.
author: Bob Dylan

text: How do you go from where you are to where you wanna be? And I think you have to have an enthusiasm for life. You have to have a dream, a goal. And you have to be willing to work for it.
author: Jim Valvano

text: I had no blood relatives till I made some.
author: Andy Dick

text: If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The person lives twice who lives the first life well.
author: Robert Herrick

text: Be thou the rainbow in the storms of life. The evening beam that smiles the clouds away, and tints tomorrow with prophetic ray.
author: Lord Byron

text: There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: I want to wake up every day and do whatever comes in my mind, and not feel pressure or obligations to do anything else in my life.
author: Michael Jordan

text: Without work, all life goes rotten. But when work is soulless, life stifles and dies.
author: Albert Camus

text: The Indian Summer of life should be a little sunny and a little sad, like the season, and infinite in wealth and depth of tone, but never hustled.
author: Henry Adams

text: I never regret anything. Because every little detail of your life is what made you into who you are in the end.
author: Drew Barrymore

text: There is always a present and extant life, be it better or worse, which all combine to uphold.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: I wish to preach, not the doctrine of ignoble ease, but the doctrine of the strenuous life.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Bad things do happen how I respond to them defines my character and the quality of my life. I can choose to sit in perpetual sadness, immobilized by the gravity of my loss, or I can choose to rise from the pain and treasure the most precious gift I have - life itself.
author: Walter Anderson

text: Life can be pulled by goals just as surely as it can be pushed by drives.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

text: Because we have so much eye candy and mind candy, spending so much time trying to pay the rent, all of this conspires to keep us from thinking too hard or taking action from that. Our time is stolen. So much of our daily life is stolen.
author: Lydia Lunch

text: Remember when life's path is steep to keep your mind even.
author: Horace

text: Gratitude helps you to grow and expand gratitude brings joy and laughter into your life and into the lives of all those around you.
author: Eileen Caddy

text: I'd like to be settled into somewhat of a normal life. Somewhat. I know it's never going to be completely normal.
author: Michael Jordan

text: My philosophy of life is that if we make up our mind what we are going to make of our lives, then work hard toward that goal, we never lose - somehow we win out.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: The shoe that fits one person pinches another there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.
author: Carl Jung

text: Life every man holds dear but the dear man holds honor far more precious dear than life.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Life is one grand, sweet song, so start the music.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: Life ought to be a struggle of desire toward adventures whose nobility will fertilize the soul.
author: Rebecca West

text: As you simplify your life, the laws of the universe will be simpler solitude will not be solitude, poverty will not be poverty, nor weakness weakness.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: I have been up against tough competition all my life. I wouldn't know how to get along without it.
author: Walt Disney

text: Football is like life - it requires perseverance, self-denial, hard work, sacrifice, dedication and respect for authority.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: I have spent many years of my life in opposition, and I rather like the role.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: When you step on the brakes your life is in your foot's hands.
author: George Carlin

text: The cost of a thing is the amount of what I will call life which is required to be exchanged for it, immediately or in the long run.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: You come to a point in your life when you really don't care what people think about you, you just care what you think about yourself.
author: Evel Knievel

text: Your life is the fruit of your own doing. You have no one to blame but yourself.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Sometimes you trust someone who turns out not to be honest. There are a lot of things that happen in life that don't turn out the way you're given the impression that they will. And I think that's all kind of a con. But I think we've probably all been hurt.
author: Sigourney Weaver

text: Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, all of which have the potential to turn a life around.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

text: Tomorrow is the most important thing in life. Comes into us at midnight very clean. It's perfect when it arrives and it puts itself in our hands. It hopes we've learned something from yesterday.
author: John Wayne

text: Life opens up opportunities to you, and you either take them or you stay afraid of taking them.
author: Jim Carrey

text: When life knocks you down, try to land on your back. Because if you can look up, you can get up. Let your reason get you back up.
author: Les Brown

text: A chief event of life is the day in which we have encountered a mind that startled us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Life is too short to work so hard.
author: Vivien Leigh

text: One reason so few of us achieve what we truly want is that we never direct our focus we never concentrate our power. Most people dabble their way through life, never deciding to master anything in particular.
author: Tony Robbins

text: The quality, not the longevity, of one's life is what is important.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: My favorite things in life don't cost any money. It's really clear that the most precious resource we all have is time.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Unbeing dead isn't being alive.
author: e. e. cummings

text: What we play is life.
author: Louis Armstrong

text: Live the life you've dreamed.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Life is something to do when you can't get to sleep.
author: Fran Lebowitz

text: This is love: to fly toward a secret sky, to cause a hundred veils to fall each moment. First to let go of life. Finally, to take a step without feet.
author: Rumi

text: Who will tell whether one happy moment of love or the joy of breathing or walking on a bright morning and smelling the fresh air, is not worth all the suffering and effort which life implies.
author: Erich Fromm

text: The struggle of my life created empathy - I could relate to pain, being abandoned, having people not love me.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes.
author: William James

text: If you find someone you love in your life, then hang on to that love.
author: Princess Diana

text: I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
author: Michael Jordan

text: Judgments, value judgments concerning life, for or against, can in the last resort never be true: they possess value only as symptoms, they come into consideration only as symptoms - in themselves such judgments are stupidities.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: I like people that enjoy life, 'cause I do the same.
author: Lil Wayne

text: Haters never win. I just think that's true about life, because negative energy always costs in the end.
author: Tom Hiddleston

text: The changes in our life must come from the impossibility to live otherwise than according to the demands of our conscience not from our mental resolution to try a new form of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Life contains but two tragedies. One is not to get your heart's desire the other is to get it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Opportunities to find deeper powers within ourselves come when life seems most challenging.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: It is by going down into the abyss that we recover the treasures of life. Where you stumble, there lies your treasure.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.
author: Sholom Aleichem

text: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot live without a spiritual life.
author: Buddha

text: I have found that if you love life, life will love you back.
author: Arthur Rubinstein

text: The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Life is a lot like jazz... it's best when you improvise.
author: George Gershwin

text: What if you gave someone a gift, and they neglected to thank you for it - would you be likely to give them another? Life is the same way. In order to attract more of the blessings that life has to offer, you must truly appreciate what you already have.
author: Ralph Marston

text: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life. With confidence, you have won even before you have started.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

text: Half our life is spent trying to find something to do with the time we have rushed through life trying to save.
author: Will Rogers

text: If you plan on being anything less than you are capable of being, you will probably be unhappy all the days of your life.
author: Abraham Maslow

text: Maybe you don't like your job, maybe you didn't get enough sleep, well nobody likes their job, nobody got enough sleep. Maybe you just had the worst day of your life, but you know, there's no escape, there's no excuse, so just suck up and be nice.
author: Ani DiFranco

text: I take a simple view of life. It is keep your eyes open and get on with it.
author: Laurence Sterne

text: Constant development is the law of life, and a man who always tries to maintain his dogmas in order to appear consistent drives himself into a false position.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: At fifteen life had taught me undeniably that surrender, in its place, was as honorable as resistance, especially if one had no choice.
author: Maya Angelou

text: In married life three is company and two none.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Thou wilt find rest from vain fancies if thou doest every act in life as though it were thy last.
author: Aristotle

text: I know of no more encouraging fact than the unquestionable ability of man to elevate his life by conscious endeavor.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: I haven't lived a perfect life. I have regrets. But that's from a lifetime of taking chances, making decisions, and trying not to be frozen. The only thing that I can do with my regrets is understand them.
author: Kevin Costner

text: Don't ignore the past, but deal with it, on your own pace. Once you deal with it, you are free of it and you are free to embrace your life and be a happy loving person because if you don't, the past will come back to haunt and keep coming back to haunt you.
author: Boris Kodjoe

text: Life is too short to spend hoping that the perfectly arched eyebrow or hottest new lip shade will mask an ugly heart.
author: Kevyn Aucoin

text: Maxim for life: You get treated in life the way you teach people to treat you.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: The quality of life is more important than life itself.
author: Alexis Carrel

text: Our entire life - consists ultimately in accepting ourselves as we are.
author: Jean Anouilh

text: You know what your problem is, it's that you haven't seen enough movies - all of life's riddles are answered in the movies.
author: Steve Martin

text: Seventy percent of success in life is showing up.
author: Woody Allen

text: You must pass your days in song. Let your whole life be a song.
author: Sai Baba

text: There is a tide in the affairs of men, Which taken at the flood, leads on to fortune. Omitted, all the voyage of their life is bound in shallows and in miseries. On such a full sea are we now afloat. And we must take the current when it serves, or lose our ventures.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Don't be too timid and squeamish about your actions. All life is an experiment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: There are two means of refuge from the miseries of life: music and cats.
author: Albert Schweitzer

text: I should have no objection to go over the same life from its beginning to the end: requesting only the advantage authors have, of correcting in a second edition the faults of the first.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Life will always be to a large extent what we ourselves make it.
author: Samuel Smiles

text: In the last analysis, the individual person is responsible for living his own life and for 'finding himself.' If he persists in shifting his responsibility to somebody else, he fails to find out the meaning of his own existence.
author: Thomas Merton

text: The quality of a person's life is in direct proportion to their commitment to excellence, regardless of their chosen field of endeavor.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: If anyone is crazy enough to want to kill a president of the United States, he can do it. All he must be prepared to do is give his life for the president's.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: All my life affection has been showered upon me, and every forward step I have made has been taken in spite of it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Life is pretty simple: You do some stuff. Most fails. Some works. You do more of what works. If it works big, others quickly copy it. Then you do something else. The trick is the doing something else.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Unrest of spirit is a mark of life.
author: Karl A. Menninger

text: Live your life, do your work, then take your hat.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Life is never easy for those who dream.
author: Robert James Waller

text: And Barack and I were raised with so many of the same values, like you work hard for what you want in life. That your word is your bond that you do what you say you're going to do. That you treat people with dignity and respect, even if you don't know them and even if you don't agree with them.
author: Michelle Obama

text: Our life is what our thoughts make it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Life would be tolerable but for its amusements.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Life without liberty is like a body without spirit.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: Being yourself is one of the hardest things because it's scary. You always wonder whether you'll be accepted for who you really are. I decided to call my record 'Inside Out' because that's my motto about life. I don't think you ever succeed at trying to be anyone else but who you truly are.
author: Emmy Rossum

text: Is life not a thousand times too short for us to bore ourselves?
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Life's but a walking shadow, a poor player, that struts and frets his hour upon the stage, and then is heard no more it is a tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.
author: William Shakespeare

text: As we advance in life we learn the limits of our abilities.
author: Henry Ford

text: The life of an uneducated man is as useless as the tail of a dog which neither covers its rear end, nor protects it from the bites of insects.
author: Chanakya

text: I decided, very early on, just to accept life unconditionally I never expected it to do anything special for me, yet I seemed to accomplish far more than I had ever hoped. Most of the time it just happened to me without my ever seeking it.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Life must be lived as play.
author: Plato

text: You use your money to buy privacy because during most of your life you aren't allowed to be normal.
author: Johnny Depp

text: The one charm about marriage is that it makes a life of deception absolutely necessary for both parties.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The highest and most beautiful things in life are not to be heard about, nor read about, nor seen but, if one will, are to be lived.
author: Soren Kierkegaard
